cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 160 miles SE of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northeast and expected to track across Nova Scotia and Newfoundland and then out into the north Atlantic

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southeastern New England, Nova Scotia, Newfoundland and Gulf of St. Lawrence coasts
weather_observation.expected_closest_date_to_port: Already passed – no additional approach expected
weather_observation.closest_wind_data_location: None (no Florida site listed in table)
weather_observation.wind: None — PortMiami is well outside the wind field of Dorian
weather_observation.storm_surge: None — no surge impacts forecast for South Florida
weather_observation.rainfall: None — heavy rainfall will be confined to Atlantic Canada
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large swell and rip-current risk may linger along the Florida east coast from previous passage, but no direct operational hazards from the cyclone center
